intro.Doc-title: MARKUP ON RESOLUTION TO APPROVE FRANKED MAIL ALLOWANCES FOR COMMITTEES IN THE 115TH CONGRESS
intro.paragraph: Washington, DC.
The Committee met, pursuant to call, at 11:35 a.m., in Room 1310, Longworth House Office Building, Hon. Gregg Harper [chairman of the Committee] presiding.
intro.hearing-info: Present: Representatives Harper, Davis, Loudermilk, Brady, and Raskin.
intro.paragraph: Staff Present: Sean Moran, Staff Director; Kim Betz, Senior Advisor; Max Engling, Franking Director; Cole Felder, Deputy General Counsel; Erin McCracken, Communications Director; C. Maggie Moore, Legislative Clerk; Rob Taggart, Deputy Legislative Clerk/Oversight; Mary Sue Englund, Director of Administration & Operations; Jamie Fleet, Minority Staff Director; Matt Pinkus, Minority Senior Policy Advisor; Khalil Abboud, Minority Chief Counsel; and Eddie Flaherty, Minority Chief Clerk.
The Chairman. I call to order the Committee on House

Staff Present: Sean Moran, Staff Director; Kim Betz, Senior Advisor; Max Engling, Franking Director; Cole Felder, Deputy General Counsel; Erin McCracken, Communications Director; C. Maggie Moore, Legislative Clerk; Rob Taggart, Deputy Legislative Clerk/Oversight; Mary Sue Englund, Director of Administration & Operations; Jamie Fleet, Minority Staff Director; Matt Pinkus, Minority Senior Policy Advisor; Khalil Abboud, Minority Chief Counsel; and Eddie Flaherty, Minority Chief Clerk. Administration for today's Committee markup. A quorum is present, so we may proceed.
The meeting record will remain open for 5 legislative days so Members may submit any materials they wish to be included therein.
We are here today to formally approve a Committee Resolution to adopt franked mail allowances for committees for the 115th Congress.

Each House committee needs a specific amount of resources to conduct business. The resolution before us authorizes an allowance of $5,000 per year for each committee's mail, the same maximum amount that has been authorized for the past several Congresses.
I believe this is an appropriate level that will meet the needs of every committee.
I would now like to recognize the Ranking Member, Mr. Brady, for the purpose of providing an opening statement, if he wishes.
intro.speaker: Mr. Brady
intro.paragraph: Mr. Chairman, I support this routine resolution, and I urge its adoption.
intro.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Mr
intro.paragraph: Brady.
I would ask if any other Member of the Committee wishes to be recognized for the purpose of providing an opening statement.
Seeing none, I now call up and lay before the Committee the resolution to approve franked mail allowances for committees for the 115th Congress.
Without objection, the first reading of the resolution is dispensed with, and the resolution is considered read and open for amendment at any point.
[The resolution follows:]
The Chairman. Is there any debate?
[The resolution follows:]
Are there any Members who want to offer an amendment to the resolution?
If not, I move the Committee adopt the resolution. The question is on the motion.
All those in favor, signify by saying aye.
Opposed, say nay.
In the opinion of the Chair, the ayes have it, and the motion is agreed to.
Without objection, the motion to reconsider is laid upon the table.
Without objection, the markup is adjourned.
